TopicTitle: Not sure what to do, KSP just runs horrible on minimum settings.

Articles.Content:
My system specs are over the minimum requirements and the game runs on 7fps no matter what. I make a slightly large rocket and even on lowest settings it runs on 7fps. I am starting to be fed up with KSP2 and am not sure what to do. I have over 2 hours of playtime so I cant refund it and am looking for help on how to fix my game. (I have a 4k monitor and have tried running it in 1080p and it still is 7fps)

Anything helps. Thanks.
Pretty much what happens when I launch a mid sized rocket.
Can you post your system specs?  And perhaps an image of the craft?

System specs are a 3070 and Ryzen 5 5600x. 16gb of ram, 3600 cl18.

 

will get an image of the craft in a few days unable to do it now.

@japoop888 There have been a few developer posts about upcoming optimizations dealing specifically with graphics. I, too, am hoping this resolves my issues. Right now, at launch, even a moderately sized rocket gets me about 5 FPS unless I change the camera angle to look away from the surface of Kerbin, then I can approach 15 FPS. But as soon as I point the camera anywhere towards the surface, it drops significantly (to the speed of a PowerPoint presentation).

The most current Developer Insight deals a lot with the future of graphics optimization plans:

@adsii1970 I read the article you  attached. I’m just annoyed because my specs are over the minimum and even on low settings it still is 5 fps. I also have performance issues when I’m in the VAB. When I select a part the game freezes for 1 second then the part renders. Another thing which may help to solve the problem is that when I pause the game it runs smoothly on 60 fps. I can look around when the game is paused and it stays stable on 60 fps. It’s only when I unpause the game it drops to 7 fps instantly. Hopefully the graphics packs are fixed soon.

Edited March 12, 2023 by japoop888
My experience varies. When on Kerbin or Minmus things are relatively smooth, but landing on the Mun dropped to 1 frame per 2 seconds for some reason.
